html:
7.9.17  2:25 pm   I've noticed that throughout your earlier shorts, you've used many different fonts, such as Times New Roman, Courier New, papyrus, and some less easily identifiable ones. For this site, you also use TNR. I'm quite curious as to why you use mostly Helvetica in your newer videos.


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/default-font.html


7.9.17  2:25 pm   I've noticed that throughout your earlier shorts, you've used many different fonts, such as Times New Roman, Courier New, papyrus, and some less easily identifiable ones. For this site, you also use TNR. I'm quite curious as to why you use mostly Helvetica in your newer videos.

     

1.19.17  8:18 pm   what font do you use in your videos?

     

8.26.16  2:25 am   What font do you use in your videos? Helvetica?

     

8.26.16  1:59 am   Hey, Bill, how's it going? Do you use certain fonts like Arial and Times New Roman for a certain reason? Simplicity? Nostalgia? I've always found those fonts to be simple, but powerful, myself. -charles

     

7.3.16  8:10 pm   how come you use the default font?

     

7.3.16  1:17 am   What is the font you use for most of your videos?

     

6.13.16  7:23 pm   what's your favorite font to use in your videos

     

5.7.16  2:13 am   What font do you use.. Helvetica? and why?

     

     i used to worry about different fonts for everything, but that became not only a waste of time, but also distracting from a viewing standpoint. i ultimately made a decision to actually use the default font for everything. it gave me a lot of creative clarity, and greater efficiency. i learned it's better to focus on your strong points, and don't worry about things that are not your strong points. i don't make my own fonts, and i don't have access to a large font libary, so this would not be a strong point. by religiously using the default font only, i found that i could instantly put all my focus on things that are my strong points -- positioning, angles, motion, and timing.
original_html: 7.9.17  2:25 pm   I've noticed that throughout your earlier shorts, you've used many different fonts, such as Times New Roman, Courier New, papyrus, and some less easily identifiable ones. For this site, you also use TNR. I'm quite curious as to why you use mostly Helvetica in your newer videos.

html: 7.9.17  8:53 am   Hey, about that super long and very sad "hi, i'm steve" analysis. I find it super problematic that the original commenter perceived Steve as mentally ill just because he was different. Condemning people as schizophrenic or messed up just because of the way they like to live their lives is an awful thing to do. I think it was pretty clear that Steve was happy throughout the video in his unpredictability. 4.4.16  3:22 am   Would you ever be interested in collaborating to make a song or video?

     

     i tried. it didn't work. the bad news is, society told me it is wrong and sad to work alone. so i tried again to collaborate. it still didn't work. i started wondering if maybe i could do this alone. society says "no." "no one can truly make it alone,""the best works of art are made in groups," "a collaborative partner is the answer to life's problems." so i searched the streets up and down left and right for collaborative partners. no one even understood what i was doing. no one was interested in going anywhere near the direction i was going. i started to wonder again if it is possible to just work alone. ....... there was no answer. i continued to assume that working alone was the wrong answer for a little while longer. and then one day i decided to try it. surprise, it works
